lexUnit.name: scoff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak about something in a scornfully derisive way.

sentence.text: A few people stayed loyal to the traditional beer , but they risked being scoffed at by their more fashionable friends .
We are moving into a decade when caring is no longer an issue to be scoffed at .
She seldom asked for advice and never took it , but Mona knew how to disguise mere advice by scoffing at any other conclusion but her own .
Many of the girls who had been in her class at school , had they been told about it , would have scoffed at the coyness and naïvety of Marie 's fantasy .
Western diplomats in Luanda scoff at that figure , though they admit that many do need help .
Bryan even came to my home and scoffed at me for suggesting that he and the Duchess were lovers .
She remembered how she had ridiculously thought meeting him had left her tingling , and was then able to scoff at such a fanciful notion .
Puritan polemicists frequently scoffed at what they saw as the uninformed nature of this mainstream spirituality .
He expected Charity to scoff at such weakness , but surprisingly , she seemed only to be concerned with how that could be arranged .
Why then , throughout the war were Japanese aircraft , pilots and their technology continually scoffed at ?
Patrick professed to scoff at ` soppy love stuff " in films ; but he suspected that he was disappointed by its absence from this film .
Cynics may scoff that he is yet another stiff-upper-lip , old-soldier type , having come like so many of the august men of the Club from a military background before moving on to sugar .
Some may scoff and say impossible … it can never happen !
Those who have seen advance screenings tend to scoff , and suggest this Lolita looks more like someone in her mid-twenties in some scenes .
Few of his peers scoffed , but even fewer followed his example of actually taking it on the course .
Certainly the Swan 's patrons scoffed and sneered at his extra-nasal perception , but he knew what was what when it came to a good sniff .
